pages.text: Paratarrasius is a ray finned fish from the Carboniferous and is one of the Bear Gulch fauna. It had a snake shaped body and was incredibly small, only growing up to 10cm in length. It also had a tetrapod like spine, however it was not a related to other lobe finned fishes and this is just considered an extreme case of convergent evolution.
